title: Deputies: Men shooting at target miss, critically injure WNY man
content:
PARMA, N.Y. (WHAM) - Two men were arrested Tuesday after a Parma man was accidentally shot while mowing his lawn.
According to Monroe County Sheriff's deputies, they were called to an area on Moul Road in Parma around 4:45 p.m. for the report of a man shot in the stomach.
Responding deputies said they could hear shots being fired at a distance. After setting up a perimeter, deputies found Ryan Pelman, 34, and Matthew Rodgers, 35, shooting at paper targets on a section of land behind North Avenue near Moul Rd.
After stopping the target shooters, deputies found Kevin Flannery, 42, on Moul Road. He was transported to Strong Memorial Hospital where he remains in critical condition.
An investigation found Pelman and Rodgers had been shooting paper targets without using a backdrop.
Pelman and Rodgers were charged with second-degree assault and second-degree reckless endangerment. Both were remanded to the Monroe County Jail in lieu of $1,000 cash bail or $5,000 bond; both eventually posted bail and were released from jail.
